DOC.brief_title: PACIFIC : Providing Adults Collaborative Interventions For Ideal Changes
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator develop new model treatment obesity , call Regulation Cues ( ROC ) , base Schachter 's Externality Theory . The ROC program target two theorized mechanism overeat Schachter 's Theory ; decrease sensitivity appetitive cue increase sensitivity external food cue . Considering BWL merit people , fails facilitate maintenance , study compare ROC , BWL , ROC+BWL combine active comparator ( AC ) . The investigator recruit overweight/obese adult assess baseline , mid-treatment ( month 6 ) , post-treatment ( month 12 ) , mid-follow-up ( month 18 ) follow-up ( month 24 ) . Assessments include body mass index ( BMI ) , body composition , binge eat course treatment follow-up . This study contribute study basic behavioral mechanism food intake , could provide novel model treatment obesity , could inform clinical decision make regard obesity treatment .
DOC.criteria: 1 . All participant age 1865 meet criterion overweight , BMI 25 45 . 2 . Participants provide write informed consent study participation . 3 . Participants possess English language skill 5th grade read level . 4 . Participants free major medical condition recent history coronary heart disease ; recent history myocardial infarction ; recent symptom angina , diabetes , recent stroke , orthopedic problem would limit activity follow twelve month ; serious medical condition would make physical activity unsafe . 5 . Participants bulimia anorexia , significant cognitive impairment , know psychotic disorder , unstable psychiatric illness ( e.g. , recent psychiatric hospitalization , acute suicidal ideation ) derive intake interview questionnaire . 6 . Participants move San Diego area duration study enrollment ( 24 month ) . 7 . Participants pregnant , plan get pregnant 2 year study period lactate . 8 . Participants take medication weight loss may impair physical activity tolerance performance . 9 . Participants medical psychological problem , take medication could make adherence study protocol difficult dangerous include . 10 . Participants history bariatric surgery 11 . Participants currently enrol organize weight control program .
